text:
Running Apache 1.3.29 on Linux, and one of my users loves excessively long URLs
(a mangled example shown below).  What seems to happen is that these log lines
break and another log line goes in its place.  Naturally this kills the format
of the logs (and could even be a security issue, however not much of one if
people know that logs will be split to a certain place [ie: <long line before
break> ../../../etc/passwd]) and as a result of removing the format, requires
itself to be fixed by hand.  It seems to only happen occasionally, such as every
few days to one log line.  You can take a look at the one I experienced this
morning below.  Clearly there should not be a newline in the middle of a log,
followed by another log entry, followed by another new line.

LogFormat              "%v %h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b \"%{Referer}i\"
\"%{User-Agent}i\"" v_combined
CustomLog "|/usr/sbin/cronolog /var/apache/%Y.%m/%d/access.%H.log" v_combined
env=!dontlog

text:
Can you verify that it doesn't come from cronolog?

Thanks.
creator: nd@perlig.de
michael@epicworks.com
text:
It happens so rarely- For a week I had one per day, and then I hadn't received
any in a month or so, and that brings me to today.  I am unsure whether I can
easily reproduce a test without cronolog, however I will try to do so.  It may
take some time.

Cheers;
-M

Thank you. I'm closing the report for now. When you have more information, just
reopen it, so we can go further.
creator: nd@perlig.de
